response.content:
```json
{
  "step1": "Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans. In a large bowl, whisk together 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 2 cups of sugar, ¾ cup of unsweetened cocoa powder, 2 teaspoons of baking soda, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, and salt.",
  "step2": "In a separate medium bowl, combine your wet ingredients. Lightly beat 2 large eggs, then stir in 1 cup of buttermilk, ½ cup of vegetable oil, and 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract. Mix until everything is well combined before moving on to the next step of combining.",
  "step3": "Gradually add the wet mixture to the dry ingredients, mixing on low speed until just combined. Slowly pour in 1 cup of boiling water or hot coffee, mixing until the batter is smooth. The batter will be very thin and liquid-like, which is perfectly normal for this type of cake.",
  "step4": "Pour the batter evenly between the two prepared cake pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes. To check for doneness, insert a wooden skewer into the center of each cake; it should come out clean when the cakes are ready to be removed.",
  "step5": "Remove the cakes from the oven and allow them to cool in the pans on a wire rack for about 10-15 minutes. Afterwards, carefully run a knife around the edges and invert the cakes onto the wire rack to cool completely before you begin the frosting process.",
  "step6": "Once the layers are completely cool, assemble your cake. Place one layer on a serving platter and spread it with your favorite chocolate frosting. Place the second layer on top, then frost the top and sides of the entire cake. Slice into 8 pieces and enjoy your creation!"
}
```
